name.japanese: マーシャル・D・ティーチ

keyMoments.title: Blackbeard Pirates Cover Whitebeard with Black Cloth
keyMoments.description: Teach orders his crew to cover Whitebeard's corpse with a large black curtain and goes under the curtain himself, setting up his mysterious power extraction.
keyMoments.significance: The iconic black cloth moment that becomes synonymous with Blackbeard's ability to steal Devil Fruit powers.

keyMoments.title: Reveals Dual Devil Fruit Powers
keyMoments.description: Blackbeard demonstrates the unprecedented ability to use two Devil Fruit powers simultaneously - his Yami Yami no Mi and the newly acquired Gura Gura no Mi from Whitebeard.
keyMoments.significance: The single most important moment in Blackbeard's character arc, establishing him as a unique threat in the One Piece world who has broken the fundamental rule that eating two Devil Fruits kills a person.
keyMoments.quote: In my right hand is my Dark-Dark Fruit power, and in my left hand...

keyMoments.title: Declares His Era Has Begun
keyMoments.description: Blackbeard boldly proclaims to everyone at Marineford that this is now his era, positioning himself as the successor to Whitebeard's throne.
keyMoments.significance: Marks the official beginning of Blackbeard's rise to power and his emergence as one of the primary antagonists of the series.

abilities.description: The unprecedented ability to possess and use two Devil Fruit powers simultaneously without dying.

reveals.information: Blackbeard possesses both the Yami Yami no Mi (Dark-Dark Fruit) and Gura Gura no Mi (Tremor-Tremor Fruit) powers
Blackbeard has successfully stolen Whitebeard's Devil Fruit power using an unknown method

keyMoments.title: Protects Unconscious Luffy from Akainu
keyMoments.description: Jinbe desperately tries to escape Marineford while carrying the unconscious Luffy, firmly rejecting Akainu's demand to turn him over.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes Jinbe's unwavering commitment to protecting Luffy, demonstrating his loyalty and honor despite the overwhelming danger.

keyMoments.title: Expresses Regret and Determination
keyMoments.description: Jinbe begs forgiveness for his inability to save both Ace and Whitebeard, but expresses his determination to at least keep Luffy from further harm.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Jinbe's emotional state and deepens his motivation to protect Luffy at all costs, setting up his future relationship with the Straw Hats.
keyMoments.quote: I couldn't save Ace or Whitebeard, but I will protect Luffy!

reveals.information: Deep guilt over failing to save Ace and Whitebeard, balanced by determination to protect Luffy

name.japanese: エンポリオ・イワンコフ

keyMoments.title: Blocks Akainu's Pursuit with Inazuma
keyMoments.description: Ivankov and Inazuma stand against Admiral Akainu to protect Luffy, using their Devil Fruit abilities to create a defensive blockade against his magma attacks.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Ivankov's courage and willingness to face an Admiral to protect Luffy, showing the bonds formed during the Impel Down breakout.

keyMoments.title: Uses Hell Wink Against Akainu
keyMoments.description: Desperate to stop Akainu's advance, Ivankov fires a powerful Hell Wink attack, though the Admiral withstands it and continues his pursuit.
keyMoments.significance: Showcases Ivankov's fighting abilities against an Admiral, though they are clearly outmatched.

keyMoments.title: Emphasizes Connection to Dragon
keyMoments.description: While protecting Luffy, Ivankov states that if Luffy were to die, they could never face Dragon again, emphasizing their duty to Luffy's father.
keyMoments.significance: Reinforces Ivankov's connection to the Revolutionary Army and Dragon, highlighting why they are so determined to protect Luffy.
keyMoments.quote: If that were to happen, I could never face Dragon again!

abilities.description: A hormone technique that enhances Ivankov's facial features for combat purposes.

reveals.information: Deep sense of responsibility to Dragon to keep Luffy alive

keyMoments.title: Emerges from Below and Pursues Luffy
keyMoments.description: Despite falling into a chasm earlier, Admiral Akainu climbs back up from below the cliff and continues his relentless chase of Luffy.
keyMoments.significance: Showcases Akainu's terrifying determination and strength, heightening the danger for Luffy's escape from Marineford.

reveals.information: Demonstrates unwavering determination and refusal to let any pirate escape, even after being knocked into a chasm

keyMoments.title: Reacts to Blackbeard's Dual Devil Fruits
keyMoments.description: Marco realizes that Teach has become far beyond normal to possess two Devil Fruit powers, expressing shock at the impossible phenomenon.
keyMoments.significance: Shows that even experienced pirates like Marco are completely stunned by Blackbeard's unprecedented ability.

keyMoments.title: Warns Jinbe About Distractions
keyMoments.description: Vista advises Jinbe not to fall for any distractions while caring for the still unconscious Luffy.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Vista's tactical thinking and concern for protecting Luffy during the chaotic escape from Marineford.

keyMoments.title: Remains Unconscious While Being Protected
keyMoments.description: Luffy remains unconscious from the emotional and physical trauma of Ace's death while Jinbe carries him to safety and multiple allies defend him from Akainu.
keyMoments.significance: Luffy's vulnerable state demonstrates the heavy toll of Ace's death and emphasizes how much his allies care for him.

reveals.information: Remains unconscious and vulnerable after witnessing Ace's death, requiring protection from allies

keyMoments.title: Uses Great Scissors to Block Akainu
keyMoments.description: Inazuma uses their Great Scissors ability (Choki Choki no Mi) to create a blockade against Akainu's magma attacks, helping Ivankov defend against the Admiral.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Inazuma's loyalty and tactical use of their Devil Fruit power in a desperate defensive battle.

name.japanese: シルバーズ・レイリー

keyMoments.title: Reacts to Whitebeard's Death with Tears and Smile
keyMoments.description: Rayleigh watches the news of Whitebeard's death with a mixture of tears and a smile, bidding the old legend a nice journey to the afterlife.
keyMoments.significance: Shows respect between legendary pirates and marks the passing of an era with Rayleigh's emotional but accepting response.

reveals.information: Deep respect for Whitebeard despite being former rivals, showing emotional response to his death

name.japanese: ドンキホーテ・ドフラミンゴ

keyMoments.title: Cheers at Blackbeard's Cunning Plan
keyMoments.description: Doflamingo watches the events at Marineford unfold and cheers at the news, believing Teach to be quite a thinker and recognizing the brilliance of his scheme.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes Doflamingo's appreciation for cunning and chaos, foreshadowing his own manipulative nature.

reveals.information: Shows appreciation for Blackbeard's cunning and chaotic nature, revealing his own tendency to enjoy manipulation

keyMoments.title: Watches Whitebeard vs Blackbeard (Anime Original)
keyMoments.description: In an anime-original scene, Buggy watches the confrontation and makes excuses about why he cannot attack Whitebeard, displaying his characteristic cowardice before planning to flee.
keyMoments.significance: Provides comic relief and showcases Buggy's survival instincts during the war.
